column5: Just picked up a new grp 24 deep cycle that I'm installing as a house battery and I noticed that the electrolyte level was low.  Is this normal for a new battery?  I bought it at costco - $95 plus $10 core.  Each level was about the same so I just brought it up to the appropriate level with distilled and hooked it up to the charger.
Provided the acid was at least above the plates, you should have charged it first.. and then topped it to the rings when fully charged

Provided the acid was at least above the plates, you should have charged it first.. and then topped it to the rings when fully charged X2, during charging the level can come up and overflow.  Too late now.

Just picked up a new grp 24 deep cycle that I'm installing as a house battery and I noticed that the electrolyte level was low.  Is this normal for a new battery?  I bought it at costco - $95 plus $10 core.  Each level was about the same so I just brought it up to the appropriate level with distilled and hooked it up to the charger.   When did you purchase?  I need to get two new batteries - went into my local Costco but they did not have any (nor was there any indication/price tags on the shelves).  Wondering if they don't show up until later - or if I will need to go to a different warehouse.
Great deal for 2 batteries and an onboard charger here in the OFC classifieds...

When did you purchase?  I need to get two new batteries - went into my local Costco but they did not have any (nor was there any indication/price tags on the shelves).  Wondering if they don't show up until later - or if I will need to go to a different warehouse.  They moved them into  the tire shop at the Ancaster store, maybe they did the same at yours....
They moved them into  the tire shop at the Ancaster store, maybe they did the same at yours....  Ok.  Never thought to look there, but you might be right.  I will swing by and check it out again.
Yep, check tire shop.  They moved them at our closest Costco as well.
